intro: Streptanthus heterophyllus, commonly known as the variable leaf whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants, and is characterized by its small, white or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are highly variable in shape and size, which is reflected in its scientific name. Streptanthus heterophyllus is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
